name: Against Malaria Foundation
mission: We fund and provide long-lasting insecticidal nets (LLINs) to protect those at risk from malaria.
theoryOfChange: The Against Malaria Foundation (AMF) outlines its strategic framework through its 'How we make decisions' page and 'AMF Methodology' within its annual reports. This framework details their approach to funding and distributing long-lasting insecticidal nets (LLINs) to reduce malaria. Key elements include identifying high-risk malaria areas with a need for nets, partnering with reliable distribution organizations, and adhering to four operational principles: accurate household-level net need data, independent supervision during distribution, post-distribution monitoring of net use and condition, and tracking monthly malaria case rate data. AMF's guiding principles are impact, accountability, transparency, and efficiency, ensuring that 100% of public donations are used to purchase nets. They also emphasize rigorous monitoring and evaluation to track net usage and impact, and report on these activities transparently.

evaluationSources: The Life You Can Save - Top Rated 2012 to 2025
Giving What We Can - Top Rated 2012 to 2025

dimension_explanations.alignment: While the cause of global health is urgent, the organization has a low donor fit for those seeking specific Islamic charitable structures, though it remains a highly transparent option for general sadaqah [7]. The foundation's track record is established through detailed planning documents and household monitoring across distribution zones [3][6].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates high effectiveness by maintaining a Charity Navigator score of 94.0/100 and providing transparent data on net usage and hanging status through smartphone surveys and technical reports [1][4][5]. Its financial model is highly efficient, reporting a total revenue of $62,286,888 with zero fundraising costs [1][2].

alignment.improvement: The charity could <cite id="20">highlight the humanitarian dimensions</cite> of its work in Muslim-majority countries to better resonate with faith-driven donors.

Value rigorous data and technical monitoring reports
Prefer simple, proven interventions like malaria nets
Looking for the highest possible impact per dollar spent

The organization has a very narrow focus on a single disease
Revenue has seen a recent downward trend
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fulfill zakat obligations or those who prefer supporting multi-service community development projects.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade A due to <cite id="12">extensive technical reports</cite> and <cite id="15">smartphone-based monitoring</cite> of net usage.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: AMF funds LLINs and works with partners to ensure they are used, tracking impact through <cite id="10">post-distribution check-ups</cite>.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that nets are not just delivered, but are actually hung and protecting families from malaria.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Malaria remains a leading cause of death in target regions, and AMF's <cite id="21">declining revenue</cite> suggests a significant gap in funding for planned distributions.
strategic_priorities: Expand net distribution in high-burden countries

peer_comparison.differentiator: AMF's <cite id="4">100.0% program ratio</cite> significantly exceeds the <cite id="22">peer median of 84.6%</cite>.

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="4">100.0% program expense ratio</cite> and spends <cite id="9">$0.00 to raise every $1</cite> in public funds.
AMF conducts <cite id="10">post-distribution check-ups</cite> to ensure nets are <cite id="11">properly hung and utilized</cite> by beneficiaries.
The charity holds a <cite id="8">94/100 rating from Charity Navigator</cite> and provides <cite id="12">detailed technical reports</cite> for its distributions.

strengths_deep_dive: The Against Malaria Foundation's primary strength lies in its radical transparency and cost-effectiveness. By focusing on a single, high-impact intervention, they achieve a <cite id="13">cost per beneficiary of approximately $0.18</cite>, which is considered exceptional within the global health sector. Their accountability is further demonstrated by <cite id="14">100% independent board members</cite> and a commitment to publishing <cite id="15">smartphone-based survey data</cite> from the field, showing exactly how many nets remain in 'very good' condition months after distribution.
rich_narrative.summary: The Against Malaria Foundation (US) is a highly specialized global health organization that focuses exclusively on the procurement and distribution of <cite id="1">long-lasting insecticidal nets (LLINs)</cite> to prevent malaria. Founded in <cite id="2">2003</cite>, the organization has established itself as a global leader in evidence-based humanitarian aid, operating across <cite id="3">Africa, Asia, and South America</cite>. AMF is distinguished by its unique financial model, which ensures that <cite id="4">100.0% of public donations</cite> are used directly to purchase nets, while administrative and fundraising costs are covered by a small group of private donors. In the 2024 tax year, the organization reported <cite id="5">$62,286,888 in total revenue</cite>, all of which was derived from contributions. The foundation's impact is verified through a <cite id="6">rigorous post-distribution monitoring (PDCU) process</cite>, which includes technical reports at 6, 12, 18, and 24-month intervals to track net usage and condition. For example, monitoring efforts have tracked metrics such as <cite id="7">net hanging status and the physical state of repair</cite> across thousands of households. This data-driven approach has earned the charity an <cite id="8">overall score of 94.0/100 from Charity Navigator</cite> and a Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid.
